results.title: Artificial respiration by the H N Method
results.creator_credit: Danish Red Cross and Svend Aage Lorentz
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the method of artificial respiration developed by Holger Nielson. The two basic movements of each cycle are the back pressure and arm lift. Application for adults is demonstrated and the modifications necessary for use on children are also shown.

results.title: Artificial insemination of cattle
results.creator_credit: Dartington Hall Film Unit and Tom Stobart
results.brief_description: This film illustrates, by means of actual scenes and animated diagrams, the process of the artificial insemination of cattle, stresses the importance of the practice to stockbreeders and shows just how a centre for this purpose is set up and run.

results.title: Artificial breeding of dairy cattle
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: Demonstrates artificial insemination of dairy cattle at the Aberdeen Breeding Station, N.S.W., and shows how the productive capacity of an average herd can be improved, through careful selection of bulls, handling of cattle, collection and testing of semen, including the construction of an artificial vagina, and insemination of cows. Mentions the advantages of the artificial breeding of dairy cattle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kingsford-Smith, Kingcroft Productions and Jack Gardiner
results.description: Demonstrates artificial insemination of dairy cattle at the Aberdeen Breeding Station, N.S.W., and shows how the productive capacity of an average herd can be improved, through careful selection of bulls, handling of cattle, collection and testing of semen, including the construction of an artificial vagina, and insemination of cows. results.title: Article 55
results.creator_credit: Department of Public Information of the United Nations and Leo Seltzer
results.brief_description: Article 55 of the United Nations Charter provides for the promotion of economic and social progress and development. The film shows how a mission to Bolivia was established, and pictures the complete problem which faces them. Shows also how Bolivia suffers with other undeveloped countries the burdens of ill health, of relying on depression prone primary exports, and of lacking the fundamental facilities which attract overseas capital.

results.title: Arthur Penn: the director during the filming of "Little Big Man"
results.creator_credit: Elliott Erwitt Enterprises and Elliott Erwitt
results.brief_description: A portrait of the director Arthur Penn at work on the film ‘Little Big Man’. Using extracts from the film and footage shot behind-the-scene this film illustrates the two main problems involved in the production of a film, the relationship between director and star and the insertion of the director’s personal convictions into his film.
results.title_for_label: Arthur Penn: the director during the filming of “Little Big Man”

results.title: Arthur Miller
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers of today”.
A reissue of a program made in the 50’s for the Educational Television & Radio Center in the United States. Playwright, Arthur Miller, (“The Crucible”, “Death of a salesman”, “From the bridge”) is interviewed by Walter Kerr, drama critic with the New York Herald Tribune. Miller explains his views on live theatre, the need he sees for drama which transcends classes and communicates with all levels of society, and his abhorrence for obscure “literary” drama.

results.title: Arthur C Clarke presents the colours of infinity
results.creator_credit: Paul Sinclair, Gordon Films and Nigel Lesmoir-Gordon
results.brief_description: The subject of this video is the recent discovery in New York by Dr Benoit Mandelbrot of the Mandelbrot Set. This discovery led to the development of a new mathematical discipline- fractal geometry. Mandelbrot’s discovery was aided by the development of the silicon chip in the 1970’s. It was in the 1980’s, assisted by a super computer at IBN laboratories in New York that Mandelbrot’s startling discovery was made. Author and inventor Dr Arthur C Clarke explores the Mandelbrot Set and fractal world along with fellow colleagues Dr Benoit Mandelbrot, Professor Stephen Hawking, Dr Michael Barnsley and Professor Ian Stewart. Clarke (who wrote the script) postulates on the effect these discoveries will have on the future.
